Topic.Title: Carl Icahn is partnering with Southeastern Asset (8.4% stake) to wage a proxy battle to acquire...

Message.Msg: 12:03 AM More on Icahn/Dell: The WSJ and NYT report Icahn and Southeastern will offer shareholders $12/share that can be taken in cash or stock, to go with the option to maintain additional shares in a recapitalized Dell. In a letter to Dell's board, Icahn/Southeastern effectively threaten to go to the courts if investors don't get a chance to vote on their offer. "Either give shareholders the real choice they are entitled to or face the legal liability for your failures."

Message.Title: Great offer from Icahn!
Message.Msg: At last we DELL shareholders aren't going to have our shares ripped off from us. As an Austin resident, I have been following Dell rather closely for years and know that the company is poised to make a dramatic comeback. Over that past several years, DELL has spent over $12BLN buying companies that bring it into the tech service sector and away from its dependency on hardware sales. As expected, these purchases require time to come to fruition. The seeds are planted and Michael wants to #$%$ the company on the cheap before those seeds start sprouting. Carl Icahn's generous offer allows us to remain aboard this enterprise (which I'd like to do) while doubling our stake in it. I'm all for it!

Message.Title: Read the Letter
Message.Msg: Icahn and Southeastern lay out their case in their letter to the Board. After the transaction, the stub will trade at $1.65 per share and they project that Dell will still earn $0.50-$0.90 per share, even after layering on the additional debt they propose. Applying a conservative multiple of 8x, indicates that the stub could appreciate to $4-$7/share, which in essence would be equivalent to $16-$19 per share. I think this proposal puts a floor under the current price at $13.65 even if shareholders vote down Dell's proposal, now there is a backup proposal that is probably superior anyway. Either Dell enhances his price with Silver Lake, which he won't do, or Silver Lake goes away, and this proposal moves forward. I like it. Buying more today.

Message.Title: Please - Need Explanation of Ichan's Offer!
Message.Msg: Exactly what is Carl Ichan's offer? All reponses deeply appreciated.

Topic.Title: Please - Need Explanation of Ichan's Offer!

Message.Msg: Ichan and Southeastern will take stock. In a letter to Dell's board on Thursday night, Icahn and Southeastern proposed that current owners keep their equity position. Additionally, they would have the option of receiving a distribution of $12 a share in cash or $12 a share in stock valued at $1.65 a share.

Topic.Title: Valuation

Message.Msg: Exactly, most people only look at pc numbers and cannot see long term position for company. Dell is shifting to become a small IBM and that is the value Ichan sees long term. Ichan started as a stockbooker and is self made. He one of riches people in world like Buffett - buying under valued companies. Shareholders would be a fool to take Mike Dells offer over Icahn of $12 cash and you keep your stock. Icahn is projecting company will make $0.80/share and will grow from this as Dell re-focus on cloud and software. Thus, it will need to trade at 2x earnings to equal Mike Dells offer. If you hold stock, it goes to 10x earnings on a 80cent earnings - total value with 12 dollar cash would be 20 dollars. If board rejects Ichan offer over Mike Dell current offer - they will be sued. I am a small shareholder and will be joining lawsuit. That is the issue when CEO picks the board. Board is looking out for his friend Mike Dell and not the small individual holders.
